player: Tiago Splitter (calf) will not play Tuesday vs. the Nets.
Isaiah Whitehead (sprained left knee) is probable for Sunday against the Rockets.
Jeremy Lin (hamstring) will not play on Sunday against the Rockets.
Avery Bradley (Achilles) will not play Friday night, but did text coach Brad Stevens Friday morning to tell him he is "feeling a lot better."
James Young didn't travel with the Celtics for for Friday's game against the Hawks
Tyler Zeller (illness) will not play on Friday vs. the Hawks.
Jeremy Lamb (foot) will not play on Friday against the 76ers
Dwyane Wade (rest) will not play against the Grizzlies on Sunday.
Nikola Mirotic (illness) will not play against the Grizzlies on Sunday.
J.R. Smith’s thumb surgery was completed on Friday morning and the Cavs announced his "return to play timeline is currently projected at 12-14 weeks."
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
Andrew Bogut (hamstring) will be out for "the near future," according to coach Rick Carlisle.
Darrell Arthur (leg) will not play against the Pacers on Thursday.
Michael Gbinije (right forearm bruise) is listed as doubtful for Friday's game vs. Utah.
Kentavious Caldwell-Pope (left shoulder) has a Grade-2 left rotator cuff strain and will not play on Friday against the Jazz.
Jon Leuer (right knee) will miss the next four games for the Pistons.
Sam Dekker (left shoulder strain) will play on Sunday vs. the Nets.
Clint Capela (leg) could return on Tuesday vs. the Heat or Wednesday vs. the Bucks.
Rodney Stuckey (hamstring) will not play on Thursday vs. the Nuggets.
Blake Griffin (knee) ran light sprints along the sideline at Staples Center during warm-ups on Saturday.
Brice Johnson (back) is now able to play 1-on-1 and is nearing a return to true on-court activities according to coach Doc Rivers.
Luol Deng (rest) will not play on Saturday against the Clippers.
Larry Nance (knee) played 1-on-1 against Ivica Zubac on Saturday.
Deyonta Davis (foot) will be active and available to play Wednesday vs. the Thunder.
Brandan Wright (left ankle) has started full-speed individual workouts and hopes to make his season debut in January.
Willie Reed (bruised sternum) will not play in Friday's game against the Bucks.
Josh Richardson (sprained left foot) will his third consecutive game on Friday, but is "getting better" according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) had surgery to repair a torn labrum on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Zach LaVine (hip) is listed as questionable for Sunday's game vs. the Mavs.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Rashad Vaughn (ankle) is available to play Tuesday vs. the Spurs.
Khris Middleton (hamstring) said he's not running at full speed yet.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
Kristaps Porzingis (Achilles) told reporters that he "probably" won't play Sunday afternoon in Toronto.
As expected, Joel Embiid (rest) will not play Saturday vs. the Wizards.
Richaun Holmes will not play on Saturday against the Wizards.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Ben Simmons (foot) played point guard during some 5-on-0 drills at Tuesday's practice.
Moe Harkless (calf) will not play on Friday against the Magic.
Festus Ezeli (knee) will not be with the Blazers on their four-game trip, but his agent says it is
because of an impending knee surgery.
Patty Mills (left calf tightness) will not play against the Suns on Saturday.
Dejounte Murray (sprained right ankle) has been ruled out of Saturday's game vs. the Suns.
Patrick Patterson (sore left knee) is listed as questionable for Sunday's game vs. the Knicks.
Delon Wright (shoulder) has been cleared for team practice.
Jared Sullinger (foot) said he won't set a return date despite being cleared for practice.
Alec Burks said he saw Rodney Hood (knee) walking around after Saturday's win over the Magic.
Joe Johnson (rest) will not play on Saturday against the Magic.
Otto Porter (hip) said he should be ready to play on Monday.
Scott Brooks said that Ian Mahinmi (knees) will be re-evaluated at the end of January.
Danuel House (fractured right wrist) will be re-evaluated in 10 days.
